comments:
This course surveys the cellular physiology of neurons and excitable cells, molecular neurobiology, and development. Some topics covered in this course include action potential generation, synaptic transmission, molecular and physiological studies of ion channels, second messengers, simple neural circuits, synaptic plasticity, learning and memory, and neural development. There are three exams and a final in addition to the laboratory component of this course.

The course follows a guest lecture format, so students enjoyed having lectures from a variety of different professors. Many found the course to be interesting. One student described it as “a very good course [in] today’s science.”

The professors were described as very knowledgeable about the subject matter as well as “passionate” and enthusiastic.

The course difficulty was a significant complaint of students. Some students thought that “the material covered was difficult to grasp initially.” As for the exams, they “were difficult to a person who struggles with test taking but is confident on the subject.” Others described the course as “painfully hard.”
